problems.problem: A ray of light strikes a plane mirror at an angle of $30^\circ$ to the normal. Find the angle of reflection.

step_by_step.explanation: Angle of incidence $i = $ angle of reflection $r$

problems.problem: A ray of light strikes a plane mirror at $45^\circ$ to the surface. Find the angle of reflection relative to the surface.

step_by_step.explanation: Angle of reflection $r = i = 45^\circ$ relative to normal

problems.final_answer: The angle of reflection relative to the surface is $45^\circ$.

problems.problem: An object is placed $10\,\text{cm}$ in front of a plane mirror. Find the image distance.

step_by_step.explanation: Image distance $v$ behind the mirror equals object distance $u$ in front

problems.final_answer: The image distance is $10\,\text{cm}$ behind the mirror.

problems.problem: A concave mirror has a focal length of $20\,\text{cm}$. An object is placed $60\,\text{cm}$ from it. Find the image distance.
problems.final_answer: The image is formed $30\,\text{cm}$ from the mirror.

problems.problem: A concave mirror forms an image equal in size to the object. Where is the object placed relative to the focal length?
problems.final_answer: The object is placed at $2f$ (twice the focal length) from the mirror.

problems.problem: A convex mirror has a focal length of $15\,\text{cm}$. An object is $30\,\text{cm}$ from the mirror. Find the image distance.

step_by_step.explanation: $\frac{1}{f} = \frac{1}{u} + \frac{1}{v}$, convex mirror has $f > 0$, $u > 0$, $v > 0$ for virtual image

problems.final_answer: The image is virtual and located $30\,\text{cm}$ behind the mirror.

problems.problem: A concave mirror forms a real image at $40\,\text{cm}$ from the mirror when the object is $60\,\text{cm}$ away. Find the focal length.
problems.final_answer: The focal length of the mirror is $24\,\text{cm}$.

problems.problem: A concave mirror has a focal length of $12\,\text{cm}$. An object is at $8\,\text{cm}$ from the mirror. Describe the image formed.

step_by_step.step: Compare object distance and focal length
step_by_step.explanation: Object is inside focal length ($u < f$)
The image will be virtual, upright, and magnified.

problems.final_answer: A virtual, upright, and magnified image is formed.

problems.problem: A convex mirror forms an image $1/2$ the size of the object. What is the magnification?

step_by_step.explanation: Magnification $m = v/u$ (positive for virtual image in convex mirror)

problems.final_answer: The magnification of the convex mirror is $0.5$ (image is half the object size).

problems.problem: A ray of light is incident along the principal axis of a concave mirror. Describe the path of the reflected ray.

step_by_step.explanation: Ray passes through the center of curvature after reflection.

problems.final_answer: The reflected ray passes through the center of curvature along the principal axis.
